channel.title: RSPS On Linux
channel.description:
I can't explain how mad I am.
I recently broke my internet yesterday by trying to change my ip adress for something, and all I would do was play this one RSPS, and it was really fun. Now I installed Linux, since my computer failed to run anymore.
As soon as it's done I immediatly go to the rsps I want to play on, and the page fails to open.
I can't run any webclient for RSPS, weirdly enough I can run RuneScape itself.
Please someone I beg of you to help me get on webclients again. OMG

item.title: RSPS On Linux
item.dc:creator: @obabygirl obabygirl
item.description:
@obabygirl wrote:

I have downloaded Wine, and Wine Tricks, downloaded a windows verison of opera, and then tried to open a webclient and still wouldn’t work.

I do have a c drive, and the Runescape Cache is saved in there.

Please note. I have just broken my computer while trying to get this to work. I shut off my computer, and booted it again when I woke up, and I get a purple screen with a few options, and I press enter trying to run Linux, and it doesn’t do anyting. I have booted definetly 50+ times with the same error. I’m on my moms computer right now.

/facepalm, sometimes life suckss. I got so addicted to this one p server, that when it didn’t work, I changed operating systems, and went through all this.

Anyways, I don’t know what to do now. LOL

Btw Moparisthebest, thank you for leaving a reply on my thread cause I don’t see that too often XD

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:13, topic:407761”]Try installing Wine and download’n’install a web browser for it[/quote]What why? There are linux compatible java plugins for browsers, unless that’s not what you mean?

EDIT - Yea spent a few minutes rewriting it and now it works fine

item.title: RSPS On Linux
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:9, topic:407761”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=509038.msg3693171#msg3693171 date=1312253712]
I have the opposite problem, my new davidscape client only works on unix operating systems, but I use user.home I’m not sure what I did wrong, probably an extra slash somewhere, but I haven’t tried to fix it yet :rolleyes:
[/quote]
user.home + File.separator

pls[/quote]That’s what I use The way I download and extract my cache was just really thrown together, I need to just rewrite most of it.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS On Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:9, topic:407761”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=509038.msg3693171#msg3693171 date=1312253712]
I have the opposite problem, my new davidscape client only works on unix operating systems, but I use user.home I’m not sure what I did wrong, probably an extra slash somewhere, but I haven’t tried to fix it yet :rolleyes:
[/quote]
user.home + File.separator

pls[/quote]

You don’t really have to use File.seperator, though you can, but ‘/’ works on all operating systems too. (’’ only works on windows though)

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS On Linux
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

	public static String findcachedir() {
		final boolean exists = (new File(System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Cache/")).exists();
		if (exists) {
			return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Cache/";
		} else {
			final File f = new File(System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Cache/");
			f.mkdir();
			return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Cache/";
		}
	}

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS On Linux
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

As mitb said, most clients do something like this:

public String findcachedir() {
    return "C:/.file_store_32";
}

What happens if you don’t have a C: drive? Or perhaps you do, but don’t have permission to write to it? Then it can’t do anything. However, I posted a “fix” to this a while back in the snippets section that makes it universal

public String findcachedir() {
    return String.format("%s/%s/", System.getProperty("user.home"), "your cache name here");
}

I’m not sure how mitb did it in the MoparScape clients, but I’m sure it’s something similar.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS On Linux
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Missed that part as typically when someone has asked me this over email/msn the issue is typically that they never installed java.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS On Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

CoonHunter:

You need to install Java. What distro did you install?

If he can play runescape, he has Java installed.

The problem is probably most webclients I’ve seen make awful assumptions as to the location of cache files and such, like storing them on “C:\foldername”, so that a game that is supposed to work on everything, now only works on windows computers that actually have a C: drive (not all do!).

However, you can use MoparScape (all versions) on Linux, Mac, Windows, or anything else java runs on.

Read full topic
